meanings.definition: To provide with shoes or footwear.
meanings.sent1: The kind cobbler will calceate my worn-out shoes.
meanings.sent2: I always calceate my feet before going outside.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to calceate its paws with tiny shoes, but they kept falling off.
meanings.sent4: She calceated her team with confidence before the big game.
meanings.sent5: The magical shoes calceated themselves onto Cinderella's feet.

meanings.definition: To put on shoes or footwear.
meanings.sent1: I calceate my sneakers before going for a run.
meanings.sent2: He calceates his boots every morning before work.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to calceate oversized shoes, causing everyone to laugh.
meanings.sent4: She calceated her dancing shoes and twirled gracefully on the stage.
meanings.sent5: The knight calceated his armor, ready for battle.
